intro: Asemeia martiana, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are broad and oval, while its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature. Asemeia martiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated for its unique nocturnal blooming habit.
